title: My Review of the XZ Premium

thread.text:
Weird that there isn't a forum after even the review from AC is out, so thought I'll just share this here. Had the phone for a while for review, and I liked it more that I though I would. I was really hating on the bezels, the chrome finishing, etc. But I got hold of the black unit, and ended up liking it.
It's still way too big for me, and the bezels are rather big, but it's around the same as the U11 or the iPhone 7 Plus, so it's not really an outlier here. Other than that, the phone is really solid. The 4k screen is an overkill for normal viewing distance, but it's still amazing to look close up and see how dense this screen is. 
The performance is really good too, with Sony's UI being pretty lean, almost close to stock android. The touch response, app launch speeds, gaming performance are all top notch, and feels speedier than the Galaxy S8 and LG G6. The battery life is surprisingly decent too despite the 4K screen. Sony is probably upscaling 1080p most of the time unless there is a need to display native 4k. Average around 5 hours of Screen on time over a full day of use. Or once I tried really heavy use with lots of gaming and some camera use, got 7.5hours screen on time over 10 hours of use. Pretty decent.
Camera is going to be a bit polarising. Some like the image processing, some just hate it. I used to hate Sony's processing and their camera UI having used most generations of their phones like the Z3, Z3 Compact, Z3+, Z5, Z5 Compact, X, and X Compact. But I can definitely see the improvements over the years. I have no issue with their daylight shots now in full auto mode.
I do agree with Andrew in his review that Superior auto mode can be a bit finicky, but it worked fine for me most of the time. I also find that there is a setting to change the touch to focus to adjust the brightness too, so essentially spot metering. For me the camera works better that way, but pity that there isn't an easy way to slide and adjust exposure like most phones.
The only downside is that low light shots still isn't up to par compared to the other flagships. It still looks good to me, but just that when you pixel peep, it's easy to tell that the camera has to go for higher iso and faster shutterspeed to compensate for the lack of OIS. The aperture not being as wide, might be a factor too. So the images doesn't seem to have as much details with softer edges, more grain, and noise. But it's still good looking enough though.
It does have other things to make up for that drawback though. Sony's steadyshot in daylight and 1080p looks mightily steady, and might be the best stabilisation I've seen on a phone. And the 960fps camera is extremely fun to play around with. It can be challenging to get the timing right, but incredibly satisfying once you do.
I have the full resolution images on Google Photos shared here:https://photos.google.com/share/AF1Q...JPWUVJMkZBSG13
Anyway, sorry for the really long post, but just want to share my thoughts on the phone. For those who don't want to read, i do have a video review up as well.
(the lack of a fingerprint sensor to me is a deal breaker in the US though) 
Hopefully when a XZ Premium sub-forum does come about the mods can help to move it to the correct spot.

Just to add on a bit, I have seen a few other reviews since then, and mine's probably a bit more positive than others. I have no doubt that it has its flaws, and on paper the Galaxy S8 is probably one of the best phones around. Looks stunning too. But when it comes down to actually using the phone in a day to day situation, the XZ premium is just as good to me. Performance feels smoother, and interface looks cleaner too. And the unique feature (960fps) is actually really fun to use. Sony does have some ways to go still, and i totally get some of the hate around, but it's not a bad phone.
Also in Singapore where I live, the price of a XZ premium at resellers are around SGD850, so around 615USD? And it's actually a little bit cheaper than the S8. So it's actually not a bad deal here. At 799USD and without fingerprint sensor, you should probably avoid it.

Thank you for your review. I really want to want this phone, but I absolutely cannot accept that forehead and chin. I do not know what Sony are playing at, with this design in 2017.
Hoping the XZ1/Compact will FINALLY hit the spot.

title: Sony Xperia XZ Premium - My Review

thread.text:
Just to give a bit of background, this year I've owned a Sony Xperia XZ, Samsung S8, iPhone 7 Plus, BB KEYone (still got that, love it) and used to work in a phone shop so I've had a good look at the likes of the LG G6 and HTC offerings... 
Been using the XZ Premium for a couple of days solidly now so thought I'd post a few thoughts.
I have to say I'm particularly impressed with it for a number of reasons, but mainly because it pretty much does everything well, and in some cases really well.
The phone is pretty big, as you can see in the photos the chin and forehead are quite large, but in everyday use it isn't quite as bad as pictures would have you believe. Strangely enough.
It's heavy, but it isn't too heavy. I used an iPhone 7 Plus with a pretty bulky case on for months so this is fine for me.
The chrome is a bit out there, as it is basically a mirror, but I think this version looks so much better than the shiny black.
The phones screen is basically the star attraction for me. I don't think I've ever used a mobile phone with as good a screen. Colours are just amazing, they look natural, smooth and crisp and no matter what you are looking at on this phone, it looks great.
This leads me onto another reason I love it - customisation. I love changing my wallpapers, and this phone basically looks good no matter what wallpaper you throw on. The more colourful the better though for me, as it really shows that display off. Also, Sony themes have always been a reason I've liked their devices. I downloaded a Spider-Man one which coincides with the new film and it's pretty cool. Doesn't change things too much, such as buttons etc (as some go wayyyy overboard) but the moving wallpaper is awesome.
Battery life so far has more than surpassed my expectations. I am really pleased at how all the big manufacturers recently are managing to get a lot more out of their batteries than previous devices. I can't think of a flagship this year that has been criticised for poor battery (could be wrong?) which is great to see.
With the 4k display here, I expected to be needing the charger come 8pm, but no such case at all. You can see what kind of usage I'm getting below. Huge thumbs up.
This was unplugged at around 7am.
Camera. Well I half expected to be disappointed but I couldn't be more wrong. Sony really do seem to have taken some strides compared to the XZ that I had last year. I don't really know what they'e done, but this is now a much more reliable shooter than that was. It takes photos pretty quickly and whilst there is still too much processing done after the shot is taken, results can be impressive. Attached some below.
These ones were all taken in fairly low lighting. Both outside and in. I used the phone at a wedding and a lot of people were complimenting the front facing camera as we took selfies (I won't share those... haha). They all had iPhones... I'm saying nothing.
Really impressive results. It hasn't disappointed me once yet, and it has been used in real social instances where I wouldn't want it to let me down. Very impressed.
I have been tinkering with the slow motion video recording and it can be tricky if you need to slow the video down at the exact second. However tonight I nailed it with my sister throwing the dog a treat which I slowed down at the exact time he dived and caught it in his mouth!  It looks great. I'll upload that when I figure out the best way, might just have to be YouTube. It's such a cool feature.
As I mentioned when I got the phone, the speed of the device is blazing. No slow down or hang up at all which I knew was going to be the case after reading a lot of reviews which all said the same thing.
It handles everything you can possible throw at it with ease, and I'm comparison I can now notice the very small hiccups and stutters on my KEYone.
I'm a big fan of Sony putting Google now into their software so when you swipe to the left of the home screen you're right there. I think that's a great feature to be built into the phone, and I use that almost daily.
Things I don't like?
Well I could really do without all of that Sony bloatware. We're lucky in the UK that carriers don't add anything to devices like they do in the US. But Sony has about 9 apps for all sorts of different things and it is just excessive and annoying. They notify me all the time, despite me being sure I had turned them off. You can disable them, and also delete them but it's annoying that they are there. Although things like Sony's weather app looks really good:
I don't like there is no night filter built into the OS. Loads of Android devices do this now and I would get a lot of use out go it. Shouldn't have to be downloading a third party one.
On screen buttons. Annoying as you lost a good bit of screen. Not a problem with some devices but when you have that chin, and then the space for buttons and then your on screen keyboard, typing can get a bit 'reachy' despite lowering the VKB height. I can't lower it too much, otherwise it is basically unusable as I'm no fan of VKB at the best of times! 
No double tap to wake? Why Sony. It was on my XZ? Double tap to sleep is there, but no wake. Odd.
No lock screen notifications. This goes hand in hand with the above. My KEYone had lock screen notifications and when I had a notification the screen would kind of half come on and just display a black background with white text detailing the notification. None of that here. So this is where double tap to wake would help so I could easily reach over when it's on my desk to quickly check if I was needing to reply to something. Instead I have to press the power / unlock button to do that, which is really annoying.
Those niggles aside, I am enjoying this phone a lot. I should have known seeing how much I liked the XZ, but this is in a whole other ball park. I personally think it is one of the best looking phones in years, which is odd given the criticism
it has had because of the bezels. But for me, it's a winner in the looks department.
Hope this helps anyone who is considering the phone .
Sorry for the length of post, I do tend to go one when I get excited about new tech!

title: Sony Xperia XZ: A 2017 review of a stunner phone

thread.text:
Hey all
Ive never had much luck with Xperias, in fact, every one ive owned (including an earlier XZ) has always had camera issues (mainly ISO and poor focus), however, after returning my HTC U Ultra I took a chance .. and am I happy I did...
- I know its a SONY but I gotta say.... The Camera on this phone is stunning, amazing DIS (even if you move, just re-tap the physical shutter button- it refocusses).. its actually got better stablisation than some OIS devices)... and unlike 80% of other phone cameras, it actually focusses where you tell it too "touch the screen" , which means when doing MACRO shots of flowers or small objects.. it actually focusses on that area producing some awesome Bokeh and almost "3D"-like effects. 
However, the camera in "Superior Auto" can be hit and miss, but very simple adjustments in Manual Mode is what makes it amazing.. so Outdoors.. ISO 50 / 100 ... Indoors (daytime) 200 / 400 .. and lowlight..800... but IMO, dont go higher than 800 ISO for any situation.. and thats all you need really, the rest, youll learn as you go... IMO, if you learn to use this camera, it can be truely stunning 
- White Balance is accurate, with lush greens and lovely blue skies,, shutter is nice and fast and low-light is actually really good...
- The stereo speakers are reasonably loud and punchy, but not too harsh or tinney.. although the waterproof membranes prevent a fatter, rounder mid-range.. but theyre great for podcasts or late night listening... Sadly, ringtones and notifications still not that loud.. I wish SOY would sort that out. 
- The 1080p Screen is excellent and gets very bright.. it actually looks like the image is floating on the screen at times, even in direct sunlight its very good.. but like every phone could be better.
- Ive only had this phone 2 days so cant comment on Battery life, but so far its pretty good..
- The UI is clean and fast, and incorporates Google Now and Assistant as a main home screen, so no fiddling with multiple companions and assistants.. SONYs Walkman player, audio section and excellent headphone audio is here as well, with Spotify built in.. if you want it.. although I prefer the more mature UI of Deezer..
Im really pleased with it.. and at the moment, your can get it for really cheap to contract £24 a month in UK, plus its running build 41.2.A.2.223 (711), so the OS has matured with lots of fixes over the months.. something which the XZs and XZ premium wont have had.
I was offereed the XZP when I bought this, but wouldve had to pay an extra £150 upfront, was almost tempted, but so glad I didnt.. because who needs 4k on a 5.5" screen anyway
Cheers

Since getting my XZ on Wednesday, I've had several people comment that I appear to sound very distant (or become silent) intermittently during calls; they can still hear background noise apparently, but it sounds like I've either moved a very long way from the mouthpiece or I've covered it with my hand (neither is actually happening). 
Having had a quick Google, it seems this is a relatively frequent problem with Sony handsets. Perhaps it's true of other Android handsets too, but it was certainly never an issue with my previous Blackberry Priv. 
The Google search suggested that turning off noise supression was a possible solution, but there's no option to do that as far as I can see. 
As I say, this has happened on several occasions, whether I've had full 4G signal, or been connected via my femtocell (with a super-fast fibre connection). 
I know the ability to make calls seems to be quite low down the list nowadays, but it's quite important to me. Any ideas?! Other than this, it's a lovely handset!
Welcome to Android Central! Is the phone in a case? If so, make sure it isn't blocking the secondary/noise-cancelling mic, which should be located somewhere at or near the top of the phone.

I played around last night leaving myself voicemail messages (I don't have friends) and could hear the problem in a few messages...but not all. I then started to cover and uncover the secondary mic, but it seemed to make no difference....the sound would still drop out but not with any correlation to whether the secondary mic was covered. 
A bit more googling suggested turning "Ok Google" off, which I've done and so far the problem's not happened again. Whilst it makes no sense that something like "Ok Google" could make a difference, neither did the thought that Sony would knowlingly release phones with this problem, so it does seem to make sense to me that it's a non-Sony-software related issue.
